name: uproariously
content:

in an extremely noisy and confused way: They laughed uproariously. Both teams were greeted uproariously by the 8,000 travelling fans.
in an extremely funny way: At times the book was uproariously funny, at times I was moved to tears. They found it uproariously amusing that this hot-shot chef couldn't even use a tomato slicer. See
uproarious
